avdta.dta

Class DTASimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.Network
      • avdta.network.Simulator
        • avdta.dta.DTASimulator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FourStepSimulator

    public class DTASimulator
extends Simulator
    The DTASimulator adds methods to find a DUE assignment. Currently it uses the method of successive averages.

      • partial_demand

        public DTAResults partial_demand(int iter)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads demand over multiple iterations to reduce the congestion at the start. Each iteration, 1/iter vehicles are loaded onto the shortest path. Shortest paths are updated based on congestion each iteration. Vehicles already loaded are not affected.
        Parameters:
        iter - the number of iterations
        Returns:
        the simulator results at the end
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • pathgen

        public DTAResults pathgen(double stepsize)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Generates new paths and loads 1/stepsize vehicles onto the new paths. This method also compares minimum travel times with experienced travel times to calculate the gap.
        Parameters:
        stepsize - the proportion of vehicles to move onto new paths.
        Returns:
        the results from simulating the previous assignment
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • openAssignment

        public void openAssignment(java.io.File file)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Opens an Assignment from the given Assignment folder and assigns vehicles as specified. This calls Assignment.readFromFile(avdta.project.DTAProject, java.util.List, avdta.network.PathList) and loadAssignment(avdta.dta.Assignment). * To obtain data about the Assignment, call Simulator.simulate().
        Parameters:
        file - the assignment directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • loadAssignment

        public void loadAssignment(Assignment assign)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This reads the specified Assignment and assigns the vehicles in this simulator accordingly. Vehicles and their ids must match the vehicles specified in the assignment. * To obtain data about the Assignment, call Simulator.simulate().
        Parameters:
        assign - the assignment to be loaded
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • msa_cont

        public DTAResults msa_cont(int start_iter,
                           int max_iter)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Calls msa_cont(int, int, double) with a minimum gap of 0.
        Parameters:
        start_iter - the iteration to start at
        max_iter - the maximum iteration to be reached (not the maximum number of iterations)
        Returns:
        results from simulating the assignment
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • createAssignment

        public Assignment createAssignment(int start_iter)

      • msa_cont

        public DTAResults msa_cont(int start_iter,
                           int max_iter,
                           double min_gap)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Runs the method of successive averages starting at the specified iteration.
        Parameters:
        start_iter - the starting iteration. Note that this should be the 1 more than the stopping iteration of the previous assignment.
        max_iter - the maximum iteration to be reached (not the maximum number of iterations)
        min_gap - the minimum gap
        Returns:
        results from simulating the assignment
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • createSubnetwork

        public void createSubnetwork(java.util.Set<Link> newLinks,
                             java.io.File simvat,
                             DemandProject rhs)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a subnetwork that includes the specified set of links for the specified project. The project should be a new project (or an existing project that will be overwritten). This method requires that a sim.vat file has been created (see Simulator.createSimVat(java.io.File)). The sim.vat file is used to read vehicle trips. Vehicle trip origins, destinations, and departure times will be adjusted based on when they enter and exit the subnetwork via the routes in sim.vat. If necessary, vehicle trips will be split into multiple trips that enter and exit the subnetwork. Additional centroids and centroid connectors will be created where vehicles enter and exit the subnetwork links. Note that transit routes are not yet implemented.
        Parameters:
        newLinks - the set of links that to be included
        simvat - the sim.vat file
        rhs - the new project
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed
